	Summary: One-time-purchases enable HelloFresh to address customer needs for order flexibility, accessibility and concerns around subscription commitment, while enabling new ways to engage with existing, new and past customers across a variety of different use cases. This PRD aims to consolidate all known use cases for OTP in 2025 for HFG to define a path forward towards implementation.

1. Summary View of the Solution Proposed

This initiative aims to deliver a One-Time-Purchase (OTP) capability experience across HelloFresh Group brands. As of June 2025, across HelloFresh, several use cases had been identified‚Äîsuch as event-themed seasonal boxes, curated selections of specialized items (e.g., premium meat and seafood from Good Chop), items from a broader marketplace of third-party CPG brands, or ready-to-eat meals from sister brands like Factor‚Äîas standalone purchases, without the necessity of an active weekly meal kit subscription for that particular transaction (though OTP may also complement existing subscriptions).

The solution involves creating a seamless OTP user flow within each participating brand's digital platform. This includes clear product discovery for OTP-eligible items, transparent pricing and benefits, distinct OTP cart[a] and checkout processes, appropriate order management for both new and existing customers (subscribed, paused, or cancelled), and downstream capabilities such as delivery management and data.

This foundational OTP capability will initially be piloted and rolled out for:

1. 2025 Initiative Rollouts: 

   1. Seasonal Boxes across HelloFresh (similar to the ANZ model but integrated).

   2. Good Chop offerings for both prospects and actives.

   3. Factor Form item based OTP purchase

2. 2026 Potential Targets:

   1. A 2-Way Marketplace on a selected HelloFresh brand (e.g., Green Chef US pilot) (potential PoC in Q4 2025) 

   2. Cross-selling of Factor meals (as OTP) (iteration on the ‚ÄúOpt-in‚Äù Market Integration Model)

   3. Further discovery might include Factor B2B using the new functionality.

2. Problems Being Solved

Limited purchasing flexibility of current HFG services discourages prospects looking to explore a new service for themselves and their household (OTP orders in funnel, trial boxes) or for past customers looking for greater flexibility without the subscription commitment (reactivation, one-time box offers). Further opportunities to capture new use cases in exploring non-box-add-on marketplace opportunities (Dropship expansion) as well as offering gift boxes (bundles, care packages) easily. 

Today, brands are resorting to either third-party tools (e.g. Shopify) or internal legacy systems (Evangelist), to enable these functionalities and consolidating them through OTP services would significantly lower costs and operational complexity. This OTP functionality is designed to cater to a variety of customer needs and scenarios across HFG brands, complementing existing subscription models. It is, including:

* Seasonal Boxes: Enabling customers to purchase from special seasonal box offers on HelloFresh (eg. AU/NZ Christmas Box); on top of their existing subscription easily through the core HF experience. Past solutions have poor customer experience and technical challenges (being built through abusing existing subscription architecture). 

* Product Trial: Allowing new customers to experience a brand's quality and service (e.g., Good Chop, Factor meals) before committing to a recurring plan. 

* One-off/ Unplanned Needs: Enabling existing or past subscribers to make additional purchases outside their subscription cycle for special occasions, to stock up, to try specific items without altering their core subscription, or to supplement their meal kits with ready-to-eat options or other grocery staples.

* Expanded Assortment & Discovery: Providing access to a wider range of products, including those from third-party vendors via a 2-way marketplace (e.g., snacks, pantry items, specialty goods) and cross-sold items from other HelloFresh Group brands (e.g., Factor meals).

* Gifting: Providing an easy mechanism for customers to purchase products (bundled items, care packages, etc.) as gifts for others.

3. Business Value of Solving This Problem (Combined OTP)[b]

OTP unlocks customers not wanting subscriptions, for trial, gifts, or special occasions. Good Chop OTP experiments in Funnel estimate a potential ‚Ç¨2.7M-‚Ç¨3M in TCVA Seasonal box OTP is estimated at ‚Ç¨16.5M-‚Ç¨21.5M net revenue potential. The 2-Way Marketplace PoC (limited scope) projects ~$2.5M-$4.3M TCVA. The overall OTP opportunity is projected at ‚Ç¨24.7M-‚Ç¨28.8M in incremental TCVA.[c][d][e]

This capability allows existing subscribers to add OTP items, Factor meals, or marketplace products to their regular orders or make additional purchases, boosting overall spend and engagement. Factor cross-sell alone projects an AOV increase of 0.8-1.2pp and potential AOR increase of ~5%. 

4. High Level Solution Breakdown (Here for more detail)

* Core Purchase & Checkout Experience (P0 - Must Have): Enabling customers to easily select one-time purchase (OTP) products, understand their full cost upfront, and complete their orders.

* Operational & Backend Integration (P0 - Must Have): Ensure that customers' OTP orders are processed efficiently behind the scenes, from inventory management to delivery.

* Enhanced Flexibility for OTP (P1 - High Priority): Offering greater convenience and more flexible options, such as guest checkout, basic customization, and the ability to manage their OTP orders.

* Marketplace & Cross-Sell Specifics (P1 - High Priority): Providing customers with access to a wider variety of products, including those from third-party vendors (marketplace) and sister brands like Factor, for one-time purchase.

* Advanced Customization for OTP (P2 - Medium Priority): Giving more control to both customers and internal teams, such as enabling customized boxes, real-time updates on product availability and marketing tools to create unique OTP offerings.

* Future Enhancements (P3 & P4 - Low Priority): Enhance post purchase experience, including easy reorder and combining OTP orders with existing subscriptions.

2. MVP Functionalities for One-Time Purchase (OTP) Capabilities Across HelloFresh Group Brands:[h][i]

Based on the detailed user stories and acceptance criteria for Good Chop, Seasonal Boxes and VMS; here are the key functionalities the technical team needs to build:

1. SKU Management:

   * Explanation: The system needs to allow for the creation and management of distinct OTP products (SKUs) that can have different sizes, prices.

2. Menu Configuration:

   * Explanation: The system needs the ability to differentiate menus (e.g., specific cuts for Good Chop, pre-set menu for seasonal box, no individual recipe purchases for seasonal boxes).

3. Account Creation & Login:

   * Explanation: The system needs to handle various user states ‚Äì new customers requiring registration, existing non-subscribed customers logging in, and active/paused subscribers using existing credentials ‚Äì to facilitate a smooth flow into the OTP purchase journey. 

4. Distinct OTP Checkout Process:

   * Explanation: A dedicated checkout flow for OTP orders is required to ensure clarity on one-time costs for prospects, actives and cancelled. This includes displaying transparent, itemized final pricing (box, shipping, discounts, taxes) and supporting all existing payment methods. 

5. Delivery & Address Management:

   * Explanation: The system must support configurable delivery dates and windows specific to OTP orders[j], which may differ from subscription cut-off times. It needs to handle new address inputs, pre-fill addresses for existing customers, and perform zip code validation for delivery eligibility. 

6. Automated Order Confirmation & Tracking:

   * Explanation: The platform needs to automatically send comprehensive order confirmation emails with full OTP order details, pricing, and delivery information. It must also provide subsequent notifications with tracking information once items ship, and enable logged-in users to view OTP order status and history. [k][l]

7. Customer Care & Internal Order Management (BOB & OWL Integration):

   * Explanation: Customer care agents require access to OTP order details through their backend system (BOB) to perform various actions like order cancellation, delivery rescheduling, address changes, and voucher adjustments. There should also be accessible FAQ content for OTP orders. 

8. Backend Operational & Financial Data Integration:

   * Explanation: All OTP order data must be accurately captured, categorized, and integrated into backend systems (e.g., Katana) for inventory management, fulfillment differentiation (e.g., identifying OTP orders to avoid attaching subscription freebies), logistics, and financial reporting, ensuring proper revenue recognition. 

9. Data & Analytics Capabilities:

   * Explanation: Frontend and backend data for OTP orders need to be correctly captured and categorized on data tables, and then included in major Tableau dashboards with identifiable filters, to enable insights and performance monitoring. 

10. CRM (list of events):

   * Explanation: CRM are able to read OTP orders and send transactional emails such as order confirmation and delivery tracking.

11. Subscription Conversion Flow:

   * Explanation: For Good Chop, the system should facilitate a seamless process for OTP users to convert to a subscription, allowing a subscription order to be created alongside the OTP order without impacting it, and potentially applying specific conversion benefits.

12. [Decided not for MVP] Benefit Application:

   * Explanation: The platform must support discounts for OTP products versus subscriptions. This involves the capability to auto-apply vouchers based on entry points or allow manual entry, with benefits configurable for single box discounts or free shipping, ensuring no interference with existing subscription benefits.

13. [Decided not for MVP] Multiple Order Capability:

[m]

   * Explanation: The system needs to support multiple orders at the same time, whether that‚Äôs a combination of OTP and Subscription order, or multiple OTP orders.

   * For VMS only : Customers can checkout a combination of OTP and subscription product at one go
